extendedInfo.description: Sync your iTunes music, album art, podcasts and multiple playlists with Easy Phone Tunes Plus.Synchronizes tracks from the iTunes store, except copy protected (DRM) tracks.Compatible with PC and Mac.Easy Phone Tunes Plus consists of two parts:1) This application which runs on your phone 2) A free application which runs on your PC or Mac100% satisfaction guaranteed or your money back (email us for details).

reviews.title: Doesn\'t work
reviews.comment: Stopped working and now it just won\'t sync at all. Gets stuck trying to copy the very first song from the list
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: well worth the few quid!
reviews.comment: does exactly what is says it will.  no problems with app - ran perfectly first time.  definately worth paying for this version as I didnt want to sync whole itunes library
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works For Me
reviews.comment: It did what it says it will do. I hope the developer can keep it working when Apple tries to make it stop working. AT&T Galaxy S3
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Awesome. Samsung Galaxy S3
reviews.comment: This app works great and I didn\'t have to be a rocket scientist or an IT geek. I listen to the music and see the lyrics and artwork thru musixmatch. They work perfectly together.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: USING SAMSUNG NOTE 2 IT DOESNT WORK
reviews.comment: i tried syncing my itunes with this software onto my phone nd now its playing differents tracks all at the same time..... DISSAPOINTED ..... i want my money BACK :/
reviews.author: Joel Joy

reviews.title: Fantastic app
reviews.comment: Been enjoying the app for a while in the free version and that was enough for me but when I discovered the plus version I just decided to award these guys for a fantastic app. Good work. The plus functions are by the way great, yeah, you can sync podcasts byputting them on playlists with the free one but this just cuts the time you need to sync to just about zero.
reviews.author: Christopher Mei

reviews.title: synchronization is a plus - playback on device not
reviews.comment: As for synchronization this app works great. However once the music is on your Android device, in my case a Huawei Ascend G510 that won\'t find the music to play from within the Google\'s own app the Play Music or the Huawei music player.  It may or not may be an specific issue for the Easy Phone Tunes Plus but I would be better if the you could later just go to the music library of your android device and just press play.
reviews.author: Anthony Katgert

reviews.title: ITunes & Android fusion
reviews.comment: Best app ever bought, transfers your playlist from iTunes to your Music folder. Can choose by playlist, artist or album. Must have if you have your music in iTunes, but prefer to use an android smartphone.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not Working
reviews.comment: I buy this and it was working fine but now the Plus Version is not working, I demand a quick fix or I want my money back ASAP, Already report this to the developer and still no answer.
reviews.author: Jonathan Lara M.

reviews.title: Was great. Ok now.
reviews.comment: Used to be brill. Used it for ages but recently I can\'t change the playlists it syncs. Will sync my original one but them says it doesnt recognise my phone when I go to settings. Phone is in Ian mode by the way.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Thumbs up
reviews.comment: Love it! Use free version if you want to sync everything or paid version if you want to be selective.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works well
reviews.comment: I initially ran into what seemed to be an issue with playlists not importing even though the songs transferred perfectly. After a bit of poking around and a suggestion from the developer, I found the problem was with the music app I was using (Power Amp Pro -- I had to manually import the playlist(s))  Songs and playlists were syncing perfectly, and all other music apps recognized the playlists automatically. This is the best music / playlist sync app I\'ve found for Android.
reviews.author: Steve Elliott

reviews.title: This doesn\'t work
reviews.comment: This program loaded on my Galaxy 3 but the \"sync\" program wouldn\'t. Waste of $3
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Galaxy S3 - first class
reviews.comment: This just WORKS. No aggravating USB conflict issues and no complex interfaces. It\'s a great piece of software that overcomes many intrinsic technical difficulties in communication with iTunes. Just get this if you need to get out of the iTunes jail and free up your music to play on your Android device. No brainer.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent app and brilliant customer support
reviews.comment: New phone and not an Android techie my query was answered really quickly and courteously. Only limit to happy transfer of music files was insufficient memory on card - but then I do have 240gb on my ipod....
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Pretty good !
reviews.comment: Well, I\'ve just bought EPTP five minutes ago and run my first sync.    All in all, the synchronisation process is rather simple.  All the tracks from my iTunes playlists seems to have been copied and the exported playlists (.m3u) look ok (this is a key feature for me).  Now, for an unknown reason, the stock music player is unable to read properly the playlists: only a subset  of the tracks are shown. So I will need to try with another music app.   Beside that, I\'ve just encountered a small glitch during my first sync: one track was rejected for some unknown reasons. It has worked properly the second time.
reviews.author: St\303\251phane Van Espen

reviews.title: Random advancing on Podcasts
reviews.comment: Pantech Pocket, Android version 2.3.4 (Gingerbread), music player v 1.8.0  Paid for the full version SPECIFICALLY for the ability to listen to my podcasts.  Some podcasts will play thru with no trouble, others will play only the opening and closing titles, or just advance in mid-sentence at some seemingly random point.  If the first problem happens, I cannot scroll anywhere in the podcast and make it play, but if the second one happens, I can *usually go back to that episode, scroll to just past the point that it advanced, and play on.  At least till the next time it happens.  Podcasts that won\'t play at all include all Radiolab; and some episodes Point of Inquiry, Engines of our Ingenuity, and 99% Invisible.  Podcasts that do the random thing include On Being, Hardcore History, and Snap Judgement.  My phone player is NOT on shuffle or repeat, and my iPod plays every one of these episodes flawlessly.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Artwork sync failure
reviews.comment: This app was totally useless. I bought the plus version so I can sync the song artworks properly to my galaxy note from my iTunes. But all it did was just sync the songs. The artwork was not properly synced. A waste of my money on this app. In case, I am missing anything, please enlighten me. Thanks. I will change my rating if further assisted and issue resolved. I do not recommend anyone to purchase this app.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Samsung s3
reviews.comment: Does not sync all music  in playlist.Defeats the purpouse
reviews.author: Riaan Havenga

reviews.title: Super app!!
reviews.comment: I had used this app on my first android with great results.  Easy to use, very satisfied.  I recently upgraded my phone and had a little trouble getting the phone to sync.  I emailed the developers and they recommended I update the PC program.  That worked great.  Good support, good app.  I liked it so well I purchased the upgrade.  I recommend this app for getting your music from Itunes.  Great app.  Great support.
reviews.author: Tom Allred
